title: Characteristic equation (calculus)
summary: In mathematics, the characteristic equation (or auxiliary equation[1]) is an algebraic equation of degree n upon which depends the solution of a given nth-order differential equation[2] or difference equation.[3][4] The characteristic equation can only be formed when the differential or difference equation is linear and homogeneous, and has constant coefficients.[1]  Such a differential equation, with y as the dependent variable, superscript (n) denoting nth-derivative, and an, an − 1, ..., a1, a0 as constants,
